          This function closes a stream so that no further upward or downward communication (other than get) is possible.
 java.util.ArrayList SinkTupleStream.flushBuffer()
          flushes the buffer to the page stream and gets a new empty buffer to fill up.
 java.util.ArrayList SinkTupleStream.getCtrlMsg(int timeout)
          This function returns a control element put down stream, if any exists.
 java.util.ArrayList PageStream.getCtrlMsgFromSink(int timeout)
          This function returns a control flag sent from the sink operator (the operator "above" this operator in the query tree) a.k.a.
 TuplePage PageStream.getPageFromSource(int timeout)
          Get a page from the source operator (toConsumerQueue).
 Tuple SourceTupleStream.getTuple(int timeout)
          Get a tuple from the stream.
private  java.util.ArrayList SinkTupleStream.processCtrlFlag(java.util.ArrayList ctrl)
          SinkTupleStream handles some control messages - this function makes sure the handling is uniform.

 void SinkTupleStream.put(org.w3c.dom.Node node)
          put a dom node (typically a document) into the stream - this is for the use of StreamScan, DTDScan, etc.
 int SourceTupleStream.putCtrlMsg(int ctrlMsgId, java.lang.String ctrlMsg)
          This function puts a control element down stream.
 java.util.ArrayList SinkTupleStream.putCtrlMsg(int controlMsgId, java.lang.String ctrlMsg)
          This functions puts a control message in the sink buffer (upstream buffer).
 int PageStream.putCtrlMsgToSource(int ctrlMsgId, java.lang.String ctrlMsgStr)
          Put a controlPage to the source (toProducer queue).
 java.util.ArrayList PageStream.putPageToSink(TuplePage page)
          Put a page to the Sink operator - a.k.a.
 java.util.ArrayList SinkTupleStream.putTuple(Tuple tuple)
          Puts a stream tuple element to the sink (in the up stream buffer.) This is successful only is no control information was previously received from the sink (in the down stream buffer).
 void SinkTupleStream.putTupleNoCtrlMsg(Tuple tuple)
           
private  void SinkTupleStream.reflectPartial()
          put a SYNC_PARTIAL into the sink stream (upstream).
